title: What skills should a music writer develop? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, first of all, do you have ideas for a song and some lyrics? Do you play an instrument or read or write music. Now I do not do either of the latter 2 but I “hear” the music in my head. If you don’t “hear” the music, then perhaps start with your idea for a song and write out the lyrics. If you have any melody ideas perhaps you could find a friend or someone who plays an instrument or if you do, pick out the tune on whatever instrument you have. Find someone in your area who is involved in composing or playing and take your ideas to him/her and see if they can help you. I wish you well.

You need to be able to read music as fluently as possible. You should also be able to play at least one instrument, most likely either keyboard or guitar, (or other stringed instrument.) You may also want to be able to write poetry or prose in a style usable for songs.
